definition: self-employed/profession
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
office/duty
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
surname Ye

sentences.english: Guru. com - The world's largest online marketplace for freelance talent.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大的網上市場，爲自由職業人才。

sentences.english: Freelancing is often about choosing your battles and going with the flow.
sentences.chinese: 自由職業往往是選擇你的戰場，並且順勢而行。

sentences.english: Nothing big. Maybe just pick up some freelance work.
sentences.chinese: 沒什麼的，只是揀點自由職業做做。

sentences.english: I am a free-lance web designer that needs a little help.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個自由職業的網頁設計師，需要一些幫助。

sentences.english: Freelance character modeller require to create 8 ghost characters from our sketches.
sentences.chinese: 自由職業性格模型專家要求我們創造草圖8鬼字符。

sentences.english: One of the great benefits of freelancing is being able to define your own hours.
sentences.chinese: 自由職業的一大好處就是自己安排工作時間。

sentences.english: That got me wondering about the issue of loneliness and freelancing.
sentences.chinese: 這使我開始思考寂寞與自由職業的關係。

sentences.english: Yunghi Kim is a freelance photographer based in New York.
sentences.chinese: 金英喜是紐約的一個自由職業攝影師。

sentences.english: E. g. He has great interest in working as a freelancer.
sentences.chinese: 他對做個自由職業人很感興趣。

sentences.english: Serge is a brilliant freelance illustrator from France.
sentences.chinese: 嗶嘰是從法國輝煌的自由職業插畫家。

definition: (metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
written translation
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
animals
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
currency exchange rate
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to move one's base (of operations)/to reposition/to relocate
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to play deaf-mute
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
day laborer/temporary work
to support one's family (idiom)
